intro: Echinospartum boissieri, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, globe-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has silvery-gray foliage and a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to arid environments. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Echinospartum boissieri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
